content.description: Start on the thin face a few feet left of the tree and crack.Make thin moves up and right to gain the crack (photo), up the crack and then step left, up and to the top.
content.protection: TR or a good spotter for the first moves, then small stuff for the crack.  There's one pition in place and a totally strange single bolt at the very top. (DUH, like there weren't trees around to belay from?!)

content.description:
Most easily accessed by walking down through the woods from near Trail Magic, I've always considered this to be "middle"; i.e. higher than the lower ledges and lower than the upper ledges/slab. In actuality, I believe it is the far left extension of the lower ledges.

 From the base of what I've called "First Crack" one can move left and find other potential climbs.
